conclusion: Problem involves finding temperature at state B for an ideal gas using a p-V diagram.
p-V diagram has volume on x-axis and pressure on y-axis with points A, B, and C.
Point A is at (1 × 10^-3 m³, 3 × 10^5 Pa), point B at (2 × 10^-3 m³, 2 × 10^5 Pa), and point C at (3 × 10^-3 m³, 2 × 10^5 Pa).
Ideal gas law PV = nRT is applicable.
Number of moles n is constant.
Convert temperature at state A from Celsius to Kelvin: 300.15 K.
From A to B, volume increases and pressure decreases.
Use ideal gas law at points A and B to find T_B.
Set up ratio T_B / T_A = (P_B * V_B) / (P_A * V_A).
Calculate T_B using T_B = T_A * (P_B * V_B) / (P_A * V_A).
